title: Drawing, ca. 1770
medium: Black crayon, pen and ink, brush and sepia on laid paper
markings: Watermark: Strasburg lily with beehive below
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors
description: On top are three capitals connected by an entablature, with candles standing beside the capitals, except at the left, where the capital is on top of a column and the candlestick is farther from it. The entablature is decorated with festoons. Below the entablature is a frieze with two escutcheons beside a trophy of arms. Partially squared.

tombstone.epitaph: Drawing, ca. 1770. Black crayon, pen and ink, brush and sepia on laid paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors. 1901-39-1235.
